link.title: Athletics - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: In accordance with the announcement from Governor Wolf on April 9, 2020, the Philipsburg-Osceola Area School District will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 academic school year due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

div.label: Translate Page

div.div: Soup Monday was a huge success!
The POASD School Board and Administrative Team appreciate the staff supporting the community in this time of crisis. 179 orders of soup were donated and served to local veterans and senior citizens.
POMS students raised $3,938.60 for pediatric cancer during their annual Mini-THON.
Cat in the Hat visited third grade at Philipsburg Elementary to help celebrate Dr. Seuss's birthday. He read his favorite book of course!

Thanks to Kaleb Richardson and friends who wanted to raise awareness about the global water crisis, the Thirst Project, a Los Angeles based non-profit, presented at POHS. There will be a 5K walk and run on Sunday, May 3rd at the POHS track to raise awareness within the community.
Congratulations to Osceola Mills Elementary's bucket fillers of the month for January. These students go above and beyond to show they are safe, respectful, and responsible.

img.alt: Philipsburg Elementary named "Distinguished Title 1 School" for 2019-2020

div.a: Philipsburg Elementary named "Distinguished Title 1 School" for 2019-2020

Philipsburg Elementary has been recognized by the state Division of Federal programs for the title of Distinguished Title 1 School. The award was given because of the PSSA growth shown between 2018 and 2019. The Progress has more coverage of the school's honor.

div.div: The POMS Math Counts team took 3rd place in the Centre Region on Saturday, February 1st.
Front Row from left: Mikaiya Dymeck, Ben Coudriet, Caitlyn Irwin, Ella Wallace, Brynna Parish, LuAnn Dong Back Row from left: Maddie Cartwright, Colton Moore, Kate Meyers, Emmy Reams
The Mighty Mountie mentors at POMS presented an anti-bullying program, Empowering the Bystander, to 5th grade students.

5th grader, Nora Burns, won the poster contest sponsored by Centre County Recycling and Weis Markets. Nora and POMS received Weis gift cards, and all POMS students received a calendar featuring Nora's work.
Congratulations to Mrs. Miller on receiving a STEM grant to support the 6th grade coding program at POMS!

div.a: POHS Freshman Preston Putillion made a gracious donation to the YMCA Backpack Program by purchasing and donating 75 backpacks through money he raised by cutting grass and shoveling walks. Thank you Preston!

span.font: Philipsburg-Osceola School District Continuity of Education Plan

p.strong: Lunches are available for K-12 students Monday-Friday at the following locations from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM:
Hope Fire Company Building on Front Street
Calvary United Methodist Church in West Decatur

hr.p: Meals are pick up only. Do not exit vehicles as meals will be handed in to families

hr.p: The Age of Learning is providing free access to all three of its programs. Click the sites below to link to the registration pages. Use the school code: SCHOOL6739 and then create an account for each. The programs range in curriculum for students in grades K-8.

span.strong: Centre County CAN HELP: 1-800-643-5432 Clearfield County CAN HELP: 1-800-341-5040

p.span: The POASD online application process is now active through the Sapphire Portal. Click the link below to create a New Account. There are separate registrations for Kindergarten and Grades 1-12. Please contact Amanda Wallace with any questions at awallace@pomounties.org or (814) 342-1050 ext. 3201.

a.span: March 10, 2020 School Board Presentation on 5th Grade

span.strong: The Philipsburg-Osceola School District is seeking substitute nurses!
Joanna Latosky, Director of Human Resources

div.p: The Philipsburg-Osceola Area Educational Foundation is a recognized § 501 (c) (3) non-profit group, as defined by the Internal Revenue Act, which was formed in 2014 and dedicated to enhancing the educational opportunities available to students of Philipsburg-Osceola Area School District. The Foundation was established to receive the generous, tax-deductible donations made by friends of the District and to then use those gifts to improve the educational experience for all learners and in furtherance of the stated mission of the Foundation. In the future, the Foundation plans to offer scholarship opportunities, purchase and procure necessary educational resources, support athletic and extracurricular activities, and reward academic excellence and professional achievement, just to name a few.
